data.title: Delicious
data.text: This place is awesome. Great menu choices (I'd suggest a picture menu for those unfamiliar with this cuisine), great portions, and good value. Their lamb kabab plate is fantastic! Friendly service that's clearly paying attention. Order at the counter and food is brought to you.

data.title: Great food right in downtown
data.text: Casual middle eastern place with good falafel and all the other Middle East dishes you would want. Nice outdoor seating area on the promenade. Friendly owners.

data.title: Not a fan
data.text:
Sometimes you gotta wonder:  how does a place like this stay in business? 

Had lunch here this week and was disappointed in just about everything.     Lamb swarma consisted of excessively salty meat re-heated on a grill, wrapped in a huge tortilla ,  and smothered in garlic sauce.   For $14, I expected something much better.    Likewise the chicken swarma was uninspired, smothered in the same garlic sauce and confined in a too-large wrap for $9.  We both ended up eating the contents with a fork and throwing away half of the flour wrap.    

We were the only customers at 12:30 in the afternoon,  so this is obviously not a local favorite for lunch.    There is a rotating gyro grill behind the counter:  maybe we'll come back if they start using it.

owner_response.author: Mike S, Owner at Mazza Bistro, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
The answer to your question of how do we stay in business, four years now, is simple, people love our food. We are a successful and thriving Mom &Pop restaurant. We work hard and take great pride in the freshness and quality of our food. It's a comfort food made daily fresh with love. 

As everyone knows, taste is relative and a matter of cultivated palates. Fortunately, 99% of our customers love our authentic MiddleEastern food and don't share your opinion. 

With due respect, and for correcting the record, I like to respond to your unfactual statements. First, we don't use tortillas, we use lavash bread from a special bakery in San Francisco. Second, we don't reheat the lamb. We use fresh raw lamb that is popular and has a large following. Third, salty is a matter of taste, some customers tell us we are light on the salt and ask for a salt shaker. For your bread comment, we also have plates without the bread. And for the "smothering sauce," we have clients who tells us light on the sauce, or extra sauce, or no sauce at all, and some prefer it on the side. We are happy to oblige every request. We are famous for accommodating special requests, and special dietary needs, like dairy or gluten free.

Our food is made fresh and prepared from scratch every day. Much care, passion, and love goes into cooking it. Hope you come back and ask me to show you what I am cooking for you. I will be happy to meet you in person and see if we can change your mind:)
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Mediterranean Cafe
data.text: We were dying for some Lebanese food and ventured into Mazza Bistro. The cafe is small, cozy and located downtown. We ordered their entrees which have a sampling of different dishes. Everything was delicious and I recommend the Mazza plate.

data.title: Good meal
data.text:
The kofta kabob plate and the mazza plate (sampler). The kofta was so juicy and tasty. The tsasiki salad was a good complement.
The sampler plate was good but nothing I haven't tasted before... Well I take that back... The falafel was crispy and tender on the inside... That was well done. 
The hummus was a bit too acidic for my taste.

data.title: excellent .jewel in bend's downtown
data.text:
a jewel in the heart of bend.  authentic Mediterranean, home made, family run, walk to the river and Drake park,  easy parking,
priced well,  I have returned many times

data.title: Great flavor!
data.text: We love middle eastern food. The lamb kebobs were perfect! Hummus and baba ganoush had great flavor and texture. falafel were just right .

data.title: Just ok
data.text: You order at the counter and pay, then they bring you your food.  The employees, which i think were owners, were very nice.  The food took a while to come out, longer than I would prefer.  The food wasn't bad but not the best middle eastern food I've had and we eat it very often.  The baba ghanoush was definitely different, not bad, but I didn't want more. The falafel was good and crispy.  Tabouli was ok, had a different spice in it that I wasn't used to.  I would probably try the other middle eastern restaurant in town (Kebaba) when visiting next time to see if it's any better than this place.

data.title: Freshly cooked delicious Mediterranean food
data.text: A classic  spot -- freshly cooked delicious Mediterranean food made to order with a small family eatery feel.    It's like a transplant right off of a busy walking street of Greece, Turkey, or Jordan.  Or New York for that matter.   Very nice people, hot off the grill wonderful taste in downtown Bend.

data.title: One of the "Best" in Downtown Bend
data.text: This place has some of the best middle eastern food to be found anywhere.  Plus the staff is super warm and friendly.  We eat here almost weekly.

data.title: Tasty find
data.text: Delicious middle-eastern cusine at a reasonable price. We took some friends here for lunch and really enjoyed having something different for a change.

data.title: Very Good!
data.text: Love the food here!  And they have really good gluten free pita bread! Perfect place to have lunch on a nice day.

data.title: Get the Shwarma
data.text:
Mazza Bistro has my favorite shwarma recipe. 

My boyfriend and I have had this obsession/addiction for chicken and/or lamb shwarma for the last 1.5 years and Mazza Bistro is our favorite. We go to various restaurants and food trucks in Washington and Oregon trying each vendors' shwarma and Mazza Bistro has not been beaten (to our taste buds) yet. Aside from beer tasting, we journey to Bend for the chicken and the lamb shwarma.

It's also cheap, they have beer on tap (like everywhere in Bend), and the staff are nice!

data.title: Excellent Middle Eastern Cuisine in the Middle of Oregon
data.text: Do you love Middle Eastern food prepared (not cooked but prepared with skill) in an authentic style and priced very reasonably?  Don't miss the Mazza Bistro in downtown Bend, easy to find... a wonderfully welcoming staff and a superb experience... wow!!!!!

data.title: Sit outside, have a brew and people watch
data.text:
Good selection of Mediterranean cuisine. Pleasant, helpful staff.

Craft beers on tap. Turkish coffee plus lots of options.

Dog friendly. Reasonably priced.

data.title: Delightful Meal!
data.text: Adjacent to the main thoroughfare is a restaurant you don't want to miss.  Meat or veggie, the food is delicious, fresh, with large portions. Eat in or people watch from the outdoor seating. The hummus was the best I've ever tasted.  So was the tabboule and the shawerma. The owner and his son were so friendly and engaging.  We loved it ALL!

data.title: Delightful surprise
data.text: The highly rated restaurant we were going to was closed for the holiday so we decided to walk around downtown Bend and scope out the venues in person rather than online.  We came across Mazza and took a chance, primarily based on the welcome attitude of the owner Mike.  We are vegetarian so we ordered the veggie wrap and mezza vege plate.  He brought us his home made hot sauce, which was subtle, smokey and just the right degree of burn to complement but not overwhelm the food.  Everything was excellent.  The baba ganoush is most excellent. I will no longer wonder where to go for a good meal when passing through Bend.

data.title: Casual, Family Owned, Delicious Food Every Time
data.text:
We eat at least one meal at this delightful little restaurant every time we are in Bend.  This is a smallish, casual dining spot that is consistently good.  

My husband usually gets the kebabs or the shwarma, and I always get the mezza appetizer plate. The side dish rice is to die for.  Last visit, the owner treated us to some beautiful Turkish dates that were melt in your mouth amazing.  It was very kind of him to share his treasures!

Give this little spot a try if you like middle eastern food.  Don't be deterred by the casual ambiance, as the food is fantastic.  And very affordable!

data.title: Just went back after a long gap and it's gotten better
data.text: Always on the look out for mezza and pita we went here right after it opened. Alas it was still working out the bugs and we kinda forgot about it. Wandering by the other day we decided to give it a second chance and they've gotten a lot of their issues worked out. We came in right behind a big group of mixed ages (maybe the kids, parents and grand parents) who didn't have a clue. With counter ordering this is a disaster for a two-ball like us but the owner snapped over to the other station and took our order while they were looking at the board. It took a bit--it was mid weekend afternoon and the place was pretty full and there had been some to-go phone in orders--but we got our food hot and freshly made. The falafel was crisp outside and soft and moist inside. The pitas were the same. The wraps were large (probably a half for girls and a full for boys) and loaded with veggies. It was an interesting touch to ask if we wanted tahini which tells you something about the middle eastern food sophistication of this market. Going back to give the menu a more serious look through and check on their dips.

data.title: Best Gem in Bend
data.text: I have been in Bend since 1984, and this is the best made from scratch food in Bend. I do love a lamb dish, and I will tell you the lamb kabobs served at this place is the best I have ever eaten. I have had this dish many times and is had always been a 10 in excellence, in serving size, presentation, and the flavor is unreal. If you add Mike's special hot sauce to your meal you will be blown away. You will not be disappointed if you try it out.
